oai_dc:dc.dc:otherSubject: Akka (Palestine); Brothers; Childhood; Courts; Honor; Illiteracy; Love; Marriage; Sewing; Social norms; Umm al-Faḥm (Palestine); Women education; Agricultural prosperity; Arranged marriage; British colonization; Cities and towns; Clothing and dresses; Farmers; Heritage appropriation; Ḥinnah; House rent; Jaffa oranges; Laborers; Means of transportation; Orchards; Rural life; Tools; Trade; Wedding celebration; Zaffah; al-Kābrī Battle, 1948; British colonialism; British-Jewish relations; Coffeehouses; Customs and traditions; Decision making; Emotions; Exile; Expulsion from Palestine; Guns; House rent; Land appropriation; Lebanon; Mayors; Media; Nahariya (Palestine); Nostalgia; Official documents; Palestinian-Jewish relations; Property loss; Radio stations; Refugee aid; Return; Revolutionaries; Revolutionary songs; Weapon acquisition
oai_dc:dc.dc:biography: The interview was recorded on August 23, 2005 with Naẓmīyah Muḥammad al-Kāyid, female, born in Umm al-Faḥm, Palestine and resides in Burj al-Barājinah Palestinian Refugee Camp, Lebanon.
oai_dc:dc.dc:biographyAR: سجلت المقابلة مع نظمية محمد الكايد في 23 آب أغسطس عام 2005، أنثى، ولدت في أم الفحم، فلسطين وتقيم في مخيم برج البراجنة للاجئين الفلسطينيين، لبنان.
oai_dc:dc.dc:tocAR: الديناميات الاجتماعية الاقتصادية في أم الفرج. (@ 13:0)
oai_dc:dc.dc:toc: Political situation in Umm al-Faraj during teh Zionist occupation and the expulsion to Lebanon . (@ 26:44)
oai_dc:dc.dc:tocAR: الوضع السياسي في أم الفرج أثناء الاحتلال الصهيوني والطرد إلى لبنان. (@ 26:44)
